node.title: The number of U.S. workers quitting their jobs in September was the highest on record.
node.description: Nearly a million workers quit in the leisure and hospitality industry alone, reflecting the competition for workers after pandemic-induced shutdowns.

node.title: 'Femicide' Charge Could Be Filed After Death of Georgia Teacher Found in Mexico
node.description: The Lawrenceville teacher was reported missing earlier this month after she did not return from a planned trip to Mexico.

node.title: Trial Set to Begin for Man Accused of Posing as Handyman to Rob, Kill 18 Senior Citizens
node.description: M.J. Jennings, one of the victim's daughters, said she knew something was wrong with her mother's death but didn't know it was murder.

node.title: Clip of Dunkin' Customer Taking Money From Tip Jar Over Incorrect Order Viewed 2.5M Times
node.description: "You stole my tips!" exclaimed the employee. Replied the customer: "I sure did, because you won't give me my refund."

node.title: Environment lawyers detect 'legal error' in NT government's secret water licence plan
node.description: Environmental lawyers say the Northern Territory government's decision to grant a huge water licence to a Central Australian fruit farm developer is flawed and could be overturned in court.

node.title: Scott Morrison now shares the same ambition on emissions reduction as Queensland's Labor government. Here's why that's awkward
node.description: Queensland's 2030 emissions target is on a par with that of the federal Coalition. Labor is yet to announce its national 2030 position, but when it does it might force a major policy shift by the Palaszczuk government, writes Matt Wordsworth.

node.title: As atmospheric rivers become more likely, so do floods
node.description: After a thoroughly soggy week, a new paper confirms this kind of thing is going to become more likely as the climate warms.

node.title: Hundreds of homes without power, flooding predicted as severe weather hits Victoria
node.description: There are more than 500 unplanned power outages across Victoria, and a major flood warning has been issued for the Mitchell River at Bairnsdale.

node.title: Stay up to date with all the COVID-19 news in our live blog
node.description: Catch all the latest COVID-19 updates from across Australia, all in the one place.

node.title: Paris Hilton posts pictures after marrying Carter Reum
node.description: Paris Hilton tied the knot Thursday with Carter Reum in Los Angeles, California.

node.title: Britney Spears' conservatorship could be ended at today's hearing
node.description: The hearing will be the first since her father, Jamie Spears, was removed as a co-conservator.

node.title: The cost of heat and gas is surging. Here's why.
node.description: As inflation roars, Americans should brace for a big jump in heating costs this winter, according to energy regulators.

node.title: If You Have Something to Say, Then Say It
node.description: Why do we prize writing skills over the ability to make an oral presentation?

node.title: Helene Fortunoff, Who Built a Family Jewelry Empire, Dies at 88
node.description: A powerhouse female executive in a male-dominated industry, she hired a team of mostly women buyers who traveled the world to find unusual gems.

node.title: Bannon Indicted on Contempt Charges Over House Investigation of Capitol Riot
node.description: Stephen K. Bannon, a former top aide to Donald Trump, had refused to comply with subpoenas from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on Congress.

node.title: Lisa Murkowski Makes Reelection Run Official, Fires Back at 'Outsiders' Like Trump
node.description: Murkowski is one of seven Republican senators who broke with the party in voting to convict Trump in his impeachment trial after the January 6 Capitol riot.

node.title: NFL's Head Doctor Praises League's Vaccination Rate, Despite Aaron Rodgers, Others
node.description: Aaron Rodgers caused a stir last week with his comments on vaccines. However, the league's overall vaccination rate remains high.

node.title: Steve Bannon Indicted for Contempt of Congress in Jan. 6 Probe
node.description: Bannon has refused to cooperate with lawmakers, citing executive privilege despite not working in federal government when the Capitol riot took place.

node.title: Steve Bannon indicted for contempt of Congress
node.description: Top Trump adviser Steve Bannon failed to comply with a subpoena from the House panel investigating the attack on the Capitol on January 6.

node.title: What to Do This Weekend
node.description: Watch “Passing,” plan for Thanksgiving.

node.title: New Picture Books Pose Two of Life’s Biggest Questions
node.description: A caterpillar asks the meaning of beauty; a boy the meaning of love.

node.title: Democrats’ Bill Would Deny For-Profit College Students Extra Aid
node.description: Critics say a little-noticed provision would hurt the very constituencies — people of color, the working class, low-income Americans — that the party typically champions.

node.title: Syrian Travel Agent Says Demand for Flights to Belarus Has Increased Price by $1,400
node.description: The price to fly to Belarus and stay five nights at a hotel is now $4,000 per person.

node.title: South Dakota Governor Faces Subpoena in Investigation into Daughter's Real Estate License
node.description: Kristi Noem's daughter Kassidy Peters' real estate license is being investigated after they had a meeting with state employees overseeing the application.

node.title: Wisconsin Braces for Kyle Rittenhouse Verdict as National Guard Ready to Head to Kenosha
node.description: Governor Tony Evers previously mobilized 250 National Guard members after two nights of protests in Wisconsin that erupted after Blake's shooting incident.

node.title: Massachusetts Wants to Give Residents Free Mental Health Exams, Streamline Their Care
node.description: A new bill expanding on mental health care and providing free annual mental health exams will be debated by the Massachusetts Senate next week.

node.title: Federal Judge to Hear Arguments Over Lifting Protections of Gray Wolves in Parts of U.S.
node.description: The decision came during a hearing on whether gray wolves were properly classified under the Endangered Species Act.

node.title: Everything we know about the Kyle Rittenhouse trial
node.description: Closing arguments are set to begin Monday, and a jury will decide whether Rittenhouse acted in self-defense or should be convicted on homicide charges.

node.title: Hang It, Install It, Perform It — and Yes, Wear Your Art on Your Sleeve
node.description: A picture book and two middle grade books introduce young people to art mediums and their messages.

node.title: A Charming, Poignant Middle-Grade Memoir of Soviet Russia
node.description: In “The Genius Under the Table,” the artist and writer Eugene Yelchin recalls his boyhood in 1970s Leningrad.

node.title: Ostriches Don’t Actually Bury Their Heads in the Sand
node.description: Betsy Bird’s “Long Road to the Circus” blends history and zoology into a lively story for young readers.

node.title: 50 People Are Being Rescued From Flooding in Oregon
node.description: Campers at a recreational vehicle park in Oregon were being airlifted after floodwaters covered the only bridge in and out of the area.

node.title: Austrians rush to get vaccinated in response to new restrictions.
node.description: By Christopher F. Schuetze

node.title: Man Receives Life in Prison for Horrific Killing of 2-Year-Old He Abused for Weeks
node.description: William Looper had access to the boy because he had been dating his mother, 30-year-old Jessica Blake Smith, for several weeks at the time.

node.title: Leaked Documents Suggest Astroworld's Crowd Was Out of Control 12 Hours Before Show Ended
node.description: By 10:02 a.m., firefighters reported damaged fences at the venue and "no control of participants." Astroworld would come to an end at 10:15 p.m. that evening.

node.title: How a cycle trail is sparking the NSW economy
node.description: The Central West Cycle Trail was made by locals and it's proving pretty popular. It's boosting the local economy and giving cyclists like the ABC's national sport reporter, David Mark, fresh air and freedom after lockdown.

node.title: Build it and they will come: Plan to create new eco-tourism and adventure destination on western side of Blue Mountains
node.description: More than 30,000 hectares of land, an area twice the size of the Royal National Park, will be turned into a conservation area and tourist attraction.

node.title: Fertiliser prices are soaring, so why is one of Australia's largest factories closing?
node.description: With global prices surging, it seemed odd timing this week for Incitec Pivot to announce plans to close its fertiliser plant in Brisbane.

node.title: Four COVID-19 vaccine jabs? It's not unusual once you understand how booster shots work
node.description: A leading epidemiologist says Australians will need a third and even a fourth dose of a COVID-19 vaccine as the country enters the next phase of the pandemic.

node.title: Final wording on COP26 agreement unclear as climate talks run over time
node.description: Global climate talks have run into overtime, with negotiators scrambling to reach a final agreement and China calling for countries to "decide on their own timetable" for reducing emissions.

node.title: Consumers Are Resisting Inflation
node.description: The jump in prices has them saying it’s not such a good time to buy washing machines, cars and houses.

node.title: Germany Faces 'Bitter December,' People Urged to Reduce Contact as COVID Cases Soar
node.description: The country's coronavirus infection rate has increased to 263.7 new cases per 100,000 residents.

node.title: Glen De Vries, Who Flew to Space With William Shatner on Blue Origin, Dies in Plane Crash
node.description: The FAA told WCBS-TV that the plane was a single-engine Cessna 172 and crashed at around 4 p.m. near Lake Kemah in New Jersey.

node.title: Environmentalists Tussle With Biden Administration in Suit to Protect Rare Whales
node.description: A lawsuit with the U.S. government will fight to impose speed limit rules on boats in an effort to protect the endangered North Atlantic right whale.

node.title: Week in Politics: Will 1 December be Auckland's 'Freedom Day'?
node.description: Week in Politics: The PM all but promises Auckland its freedom and the date is likely to be 1 December, thousands of people march against vaccinations, mandates and other grievances, but no one…

node.title: Austrian leader says lockdown for the unvaccinated is likely
node.description: "I don't see why two-thirds should lose their freedom because one-third is dithering," Chancellor Alexander Schallenberg said.

node.title: 3 Middle Grade Novels Explore the Bond Between Horse and Human
node.description: New works of fiction by R.J. Palacio, Sharon M. Draper and J. Anderson Coats

node.title: Portraits of Three Artists as Young Children
node.description: “A Boy Named Isamu,” “Roots and Wings” and “Before I Grew Up” evoke the childhoods of Isamu Noguchi, Shahzia Sikander and Giuliano Cucco.

node.title: Social Media Is Polluted With Climate Denialism
node.description: Climate misinformation is rampant on social media. Is there anything to be done?

node.title: Shatner Crewmate on Space Trip Dies in Plane Crash
node.description: Glen de Vries was one of three people who joined the former “Star Trek” star on a Blue Origin flight last month.

node.title: Threats and troop movements ramp up a European stalemate with Cold War echoes.
node.description: On both sides of the Belarus-Poland border, hyperbole and military exercises have raised fears of an armed conflict in Europe.

node.title: UN Climate Talks Set to End With Nations Appearing to Back Off Pledge to End Use of Coal
node.description: A wording change in a draft proposal at this year's U.N. climate talks implies to many that the U.N. is softening its stance on phasing out fossil fuels.

node.title: Viral Video Showing Woman Thrown to Pavement by Security Guard Leaves Viewers Divided
node.description: "He had no reason to touch her so aggressively that's not his job," one user commented on the video.

node.title: Holidays, Colder Weather Could Bring Another COVID Surge as Cases Rise in Many States
node.description: One doctor said people spending more time indoors is "always going to be associated with a greater risk of transmission of any virus."
